Title:
Welcome to the Escape Room Game! 
Type in a number to move around the Scenes. 
To save your current level once you entered the escape room just type 'exit' and go back to the main menu and choose save.
Text:
Hello! You are in the middle of a room with a shelf by your right side, a door in front of you 
and a table with a lot of stuff on the left. Where do you want to go?

Title: Investigate the shelf
Text: You see a shelf with a lot of books and a metal box with a keyhole.

Title: Search the books for something interesting
Text: You can see that 5 of the books looks different, each got a single letter on them which are B E A S T

Title: Have a closer look onto the metal box.
Text: You need a key to open the box,

Title: Try to open the metal box
Text: You opened the box with the little metal key

Title: Go back to the middle of the room
Text: Your in the middle of the room, what do you want to do?

Title: Try to open the door with the strange key.
Text: The strange sturdy key fits into the doorlock and the door opens.

Title: Take the object inside the box
Text: You got another key but its strangly shaped and sturdy.

Title: Get to the table
Text: There is a lot of stuff scattered all over the table

Title: Search the drawers
Text: You found a little metal key with a little note 'Beware of the beast!'.

Title: Have a look at the picture on the table
Text: The picture shows a happy turtle swimming in a lake munching on a leaf, how beautiful and calming.

Title: Go through the door
Text: You can see Red eyes starring at you! Quick! What do you do!

Title: ATTACK
Text: You chopped the head of the Beast, which appearently was a harmless turtle... well...

Title: Carry on with a bad feeling
Text: You can see another door which you hear speaking: Only the wisest will pass through me. Solve my riddles and you are free!

Title: Aproach the beast with the red eyes slowly.
Text: You find out that the 'Beast' was a harmless turtle. What a cute Turtle.

Title: Carry on with a good feeling!.
Text: You can see another door which you hear speaking: Only the wisest will pass through me. Solve my riddles and you are free!

Title: Aproach the door and attempt the riddles
